title: Iranian Typography article over at Pingmag
content:
Pingmag has a new feature article on Iranian typography. As expected, most of it is purely calligraphic. However, it's interesting to see a visual culture known for its avoidance of imagery using typography as a representational or illustrative tool.

[
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102015857im_/http:/typophile.com/files/iraniantypo39_6330.jpg)
  
](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102015857/http:/www.pingmag.jp/2006/12/11/iranian-typography-now/)(poster by Mehdi Saeedi, “The Blind Owl” typography exhibition)

Check out [Iranian Typography Now](http://web.archive.org/web/20131102015857/http:/www.pingmag.jp/2006/12/11/iranian-typography-now/)
author: Joe Pemberton
